dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news this week, uh, the U.S. announced it's actually *not* joining this international coalition to find and distribute a Covid-19 vaccine worldwide.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news this week, uh, the U S announced it's actually not joining this international coalition to find and distribute a Covid-nineteen vaccine worldwide.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. announced Tuesday that it would not join an international coalition to find and distribute a Covid-19 vaccine worldwide due to the group's association with the World Health Organization, the latest sign of the Trump administration withdrawing the country from the international health community's response to the pandemic over political concerns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, really? Not joining? I thought, like, everyone was trying to work together on this. What even *is* this coalition, exactly?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, really? Not joining? I thought, like, everyone was trying to work together on this. What even is this coalition, exactly?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's called Covax. It's co-led by the WHO, among others, and the goal is pretty ambitious: they want to purchase 2 billion doses by the end of next year and distribute them globally, equitably.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's called Covax. It's co-led by the W H O, among others, and the goal is pretty ambitious: they want to purchase two billion doses by the end of next year and distribute them globally, equitably.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Covax is co-led by the World Health Organization, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations and Gavi, which aims to purchase 2 billion doses of potential Covid-19 shots from several vaccine makers by the end of 2021 and distribute them worldwide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Two billion doses! Wow. And other countries are, like, on board? I heard the EU was putting money in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two billion doses! Wow. And other countries are, like, on board? I heard the E U was putting money in.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. The European Commission just pledged 400 million euros, Germany's in too. A hundred and seventy-two countries are actually in discussions to participate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. The European Commission just pledged four hundred million euros, Germany's in too. A hundred and seventy-two countries are actually in discussions to participate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Monday, the European Commission confirmed it would contribute 400 million euros ($478 million) to the initiative, and the WHO said Germany had joined the pact as well. The WHO announced last week that Covax plans to work with vaccine manufacturers to provide countries worldwide equitable access to safe and effective vaccines, once they are licensed and approved, and that 172 countries are engaged in discussions to potentially participate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So why *us*? Why is the U.S., like, sitting this one out, when it sounds so important?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So why us? Why is the U S, like, sitting this one out, when it sounds so important?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, um, the White House spokesman, Judd Deere, said they won't be constrained by multilateral organizations influenced by the "corrupt World Health Organization and China."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, um, the White House spokesman, Judd Deere, said they won't be constrained by multilateral organizations influenced by the corrupt World Health Organization and China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The United States will continue to engage our international partners to ensure we defeat this virus, but we will not be constrained by multilateral organizations influenced by the corrupt World Health Organization and China, said Judd Deere, a spokesman for the White House.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, *that* again. The WHO connection. But I read something about HHS Secretary Alex Azar actually being, like, interested in exploring a role. Is it just the WHO issue?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, that again. The W H O connection. But I read something about H H S Secretary Alex Azar actually being, like, interested in exploring a role. Is it just the W H O issue?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Washington Post, Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar had interest in exploring some type of role in Covax but there was resistance in some corners of the government and a belief that the U.S. has enough coronavirus vaccine candidates in advanced clinical trials that it can go it alone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, there was definitely internal resistance. Some believed the U.S. has enough vaccine candidates in advanced trials to, uh, just go it alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, there was definitely internal resistance. Some believed the U S has enough vaccine candidates in advanced trials to, uh, just go it alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Washington Post, Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar had interest in exploring some type of role in Covax but there was resistance in some corners of the government and a belief that the U.S. has enough coronavirus vaccine candidates in advanced clinical trials that it can go it alone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: "Go it alone." That's… pretty stark. I mean, the WHO chief, Tedros, has been warning about "vaccine nationalism," right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Go it alone. That's... pretty stark. I mean, the W H O chief, Tedros, has been warning about vaccine nationalism, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World Health Organization has warned against vaccine nationalism, with WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stating, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together, because it's a globalized world: the economies are intertwined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He said, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together. Because, you know, economies are intertwined.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He said, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together. Because, you know, economies are intertwined.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World Health Organization has warned against vaccine nationalism, with WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stating, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together, because it's a globalized world: the economies are intertwined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, um, kind of takes us back to Trump's whole stance on the WHO from earlier this year, doesn't it? Freezing funding, calling them "China-centric."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, um, kind of takes us back to Trump's whole stance on the W H O from earlier this year, doesn't it? Freezing funding, calling them China-centric.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In early April, Trump blasted the World Health Organization, saying they called it wrong on the virus, that the WHO was very China-centric in its approach, and froze U.S. funding to the organization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, absolutely. He completely reversed course after initially praising them, and China, back in April. Sent a letter in July signaling intent to withdraw.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. He completely reversed course after initially praising them, and China, back in April. Sent a letter in July signaling intent to withdraw.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After initially praising both China and the WHO at the pandemic's outset, President Donald Trump sharply reversed course. In early April, Trump blasted the World Health Organization... In July, the administration sent a letter signaling its intent to withdraw from the WHO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So this isn't just about one specific coalition then, it's, like, part of a bigger pattern. What's the impact of the U.S. stepping away like this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this isn't just about one specific coalition then, it's, like, part of a bigger pattern. What's the impact of the U S stepping away like this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Suerie Moon from the Global Health Center called it a "real blow" to multilateral efforts. She said the behavior around vaccines will have political repercussions beyond just public health.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Suerie Moon from the Global Health Center called it a real blow to multilateral efforts. She said the behavior around vaccines will have political repercussions beyond just public health.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the U.S. says it is not going to participate in any sort of multilateral effort to secure vaccines, it's a real blow, said Suerie Moon, co-director of the Global Health Center at the Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies in Geneva. The behavior of countries when it comes to vaccines in this pandemic will have political repercussions beyond public health.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I guess it's not just about, um, the vaccine itself, but trust and global cooperation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I guess it's not just about, um, the vaccine itself, but trust and global cooperation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Like the Swedish Prime Minister Stefan Löfven said, "This cannot be a race with a few winners." Equal access is absolutely key to beating the virus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Like the Swedish Prime Minister Stefan Löfven said, This cannot be a race with a few winners. Equal access is absolutely key to beating the virus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Equal access to a COVID-19 vaccine is the key to beating the virus and paving the way for recovery from the pandemic, said Stefan Löfven, the prime minister of Sweden. This cannot be a race with a few winners, and the COVAX Facility is an important part of the solution making sure all countries can benefit from access to the world's largest portfolio of candidates and fair and equitable distribution of vaccine doses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Because if some countries are left behind, uh, we're all left behind eventually. It's a global pandemic after all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Because if some countries are left behind, uh, we're all left behind eventually. It's a global pandemic after all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. It's a really tough situation, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. It's a really tough situation, for sure.
